newsitem.title: USA: U.S. MIDWEST DIRECT HOGS MOSTLY STEADY - DEALERS.
newsitem.headline: U.S. MIDWEST DIRECT HOGS MOSTLY STEADY - DEALERS.

text.p: U.S. Midwest direct cash hog prices Monday were mostly steady, except in Illinois, where sources said prices were steady to up $1.00 per cwt, cash dealers and packer buyers said.
Interior Iowa/southern Minnesota hogs sold steady at $54.50 to $56.00 in the country and $56.50 to $57.50 at plants, sources there said.
Gains in Illinois were tied to "a little better demand", as some plants were short of hogs, an Illinois buyer said.
Illinois hogs sold $55.50 to $57.00 in the country and $57.00-$57.50 at plants, with a possible $58.00, sources said.
